decks.notes: The main idea of this deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells and removing threats using cards like Solitude and Prismatic Ending. It also focuses on card advantage through draw spells like Meticulous Archive and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria's +1 ability. The deck aims to stall the game until it can establish a powerful board presence with cards like Zagoth Triome and Day's Undoing, while also utilizing cards like Leyline Binding and Wrath of the Skies to protect its win condition.

This combo deck focuses on using Underworld Breach to repeatedly cast spells from the graveyard, generating mana and card advantage with artifacts like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Mishra's Bauble. The goal is to set up a loop where Grinding Station mills the opponent's deck and then uses Thassa's Oracle or Grapeshot to win the game by either decking the opponent or dealing lethal damage. The deck also includes disruption and protection spells like Spell Pierce and Urza's Saga to help the combo go off smoothly.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a combination of small, aggressive creatures like Ragavan and Ocelot Pride, backed up by burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to clear the way. Static Prison can lock down opposing creatures, giving you time to build your board presence. The deck also includes cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker for additional ways to pressure the opponent. With a mix of creatures, burn, and disruption, this deck aims to be fast and relentless in its attacks.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Ocelot Pride, supported by burn spells and removal such as Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm. The key strategy is to maintain a fast and steady board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Static Prison. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Seasoned Pyromancer provide additional value and card advantage, allowing the deck to maintain pressure and close out games efficiently. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, prioritizing fetching lands like Sacred Foundry and Arid Mesa.

The deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach in combination with various low-cost artifacts and cards with flashback to generate a powerful combo. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student help to recur key pieces from the graveyard, while cards like Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal provide additional card advantage and mana acceleration. Grinding Station acts as a win condition by milling the opponent's deck, with Thassa's Oracle as a backup win condition. The deck also includes disruption in the form of counter spells and removal to protect the combo.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption. By using cards like Thoughtseize and Counterspell, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining card advantage with Preordain and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. Murktide Regent and Subtlety provide threats on the board, while Orcish Bowmasters and Psychic Frog offer additional control elements. Overall, the deck seeks to control the pace of the game and outvalue the opponent in order to secure a win.

The main concept of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt your opponent's plans and control the game through counterspells, removal, hand disruption, and creature control. By using a combination of cards like Force of Negation, Counterspell, Fatal Push, and Thoughtseize, you can prevent your opponent from executing their strategy while also deploying threats like Murktide Regent and Harbinger of the Seas to take control of the game. The deck aims to outmaneuver and outlast your opponent until you can secure victory through card advantage and board control.

This aggro deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan while applying pressure with efficient creatures. By combining powerful cards like Ketramose, Solitude, and Flickerwisp with disruption tools like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize, this deck aims to control the board and create advantageous situations for itself. The synergy between creatures like Witch Enchanter and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd allows for card advantage and incremental value. Additionally, the inclusion of graveyard hate in Relic of Progenitus helps to combat graveyard strategies commonly found in the Modern metagame.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, backed up by spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to deal damage directly to the opponent. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Thraben Charm provide additional support for the aggressive strategy, while Static Prison helps to control the opponent's board. The mana base includes fetch lands and utility lands like Arena of Glory to ensure consistent mana production. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient threats and burn spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach to repeatedly cast spells from the graveyard, generating infinite mana and card advantage. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student help to fuel the combo while Grinding Station and Mishra's Bauble provide additional synergy. The deck also includes control elements like Metallic Rebuke and Lightning Bolt for protection and disruption. The goal is to set up the combo quickly and efficiently, using Breach to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful and versatile strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to use Underworld Breach in combination with Grinding Station and other artifacts to create a powerful combo that can mill the opponent's deck and win the game. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student help to recur artifacts and dig for combo pieces, while cards like Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal provide mana acceleration. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Lightning Bolt and Spell Snare to control the game until the combo can be assembled and executed.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, while using burn spells like Lightning Bolt, Boros Charm, and Lava Spike to finish them off quickly. The deck also includes cards like Searing Blaze and Skullcrack to control the board and prevent the opponent from gaining life. The mana base is optimized for quick and efficient casting of spells, with cards like Sunbaked Canyon and Arid Mesa providing additional card advantage and consistency.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's actions through counterspells, removal spells, hand disruption, and powerful creatures like Murktide Regent and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares. It aims to gradually grind down the opponent's resources and eventually overwhelm them with card advantage and threats. The deck also includes cards like Consider and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student for card selection and filtering. With a mix of disruption, removal, and powerful creatures, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent in a battle of attrition.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with powerful creatures and pump spells to deal a large amount of damage before they can set up their own strategy. By utilizing cheap aggressive creatures like Slippery Bogle and powerful pump spells like Scale Up and Might of Old Krosa, the deck aims to win the game in the early turns by attacking relentlessly. The inclusion of cards like Assault Strobe and Thud provide additional ways to close out the game quickly and efficiently. The deck is focused on pushing through damage and ending the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a fast and aggressive Merfolk tribal strategy, utilizing cards that buff and synergize with each other. The goal is to quickly build a wide board of powerful Merfolk creatures while disrupting the opponent with counterspells and removal. Aether Vial helps cheat creatures into play, while Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident provide powerful lords to pump up the team. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Tide Shaper and Harbinger of the Seas to control the board and maintain pressure.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize a combination of aggressive creatures and disruption spells to control the board and put pressure on the opponent. With a focus on efficient removal and hand disruption, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with creatures like Boggart Trawler and Emperor of Bones. The use of cards like Flickerwisp and Ephemerate adds versatility and allows for additional value from enter-the-battlefield abilities. Ultimately, the goal is to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent to secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana and assembling the combo of Amulet of Vigor, Primeval Titan, and lands like Urza's Saga and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle to generate overwhelming value and tempo advantage. With cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Summoner's Pact to tutor for key pieces, as well as Boseiju, Who Endures to protect against counterspells, this deck aims to efficiently ramp and combo off to overwhelm opponents with powerful land synergy and massive Titan threats. It aims to quickly overwhelm opponents and close out games with explosive combo plays.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Amulet of Vigor to accelerate mana production and cheat out powerful creatures like Primeval Titan. It employs various land searching and ramping strategies to quickly assemble the pieces needed to perform a game-winning combo, such as setting up a Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle trigger with multiple lands entering the battlefield in a single turn. The deck also includes protection and card draw elements to help maintain consistency and tempo throughout the game.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive strategy and efficient creature spells to overwhelm the opponent quickly. The key concept is to play powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer while supporting them with removal spells like Prismatic Ending and Galvanic Discharge. The deck also includes cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Guide of Souls to boost the team's power and resilience. By utilizing a mix of creatures and spells, this deck aims to win the game swiftly through a combination of early aggression and strategic removal.

The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast-paced, aggressive playstyle. By utilizing powerful creatures like Ocelot Pride, Guide of Souls, and Seasoned Pyromancer, along with support cards like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total and control the board. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ranger-Captain of Eos provide additional versatility and disruption, while cards like Static Prison and Thraben Charm help to protect and support your aggressive creatures. With a mix of efficient creatures and disruptive spells, this deck aims to win the game quickly and decisively.

This deck focuses on playing high-value creatures quickly and overwhelming the opponent with aggressive attacks. It also includes some control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan, such as Static Prison and Goblin Bombardment. The deck utilizes cards that provide additional benefits when attacking, like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah, and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. Additionally, the deck includes a powerful finisher in Fable of the Mirror-Breaker to seal the game. The mana base is built to support the aggressive strategy with a mix of fetch lands and dual lands for consistent mana production.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch, Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, and Underworld Breach to establish a powerful combo engine. By recurring artifacts like Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal using Grinding Station and Malevolent Rumble, the deck aims to generate infinite mana and card advantage to eventually win the game through alternate win conditions like Grapeshot or Jace, Wielder of Mysteries. The key strategy is to set up the combo pieces efficiently while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Swan Song and Lightning Bolt.

The focus of this deck is to use Underworld Breach in combination with cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Grinding Station to create a powerful combo engine that allows for quick and explosive wins. Additionally, the deck includes ways to protect the combo pieces and disrupt opponent's strategies, while also having some flexibility in handling different types of threats. The deck aims to consistently assemble the combo pieces and execute its game plan efficiently to overwhelm opponents and secure victory.

The deck focuses on using Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to generate card advantage and dig through the deck to find the combo pieces. The main win condition involves assembling Grinding Station, Mishra's Bauble, Mox Opal, and Underworld Breach to enable a looping combo that mills the opponent's deck. The deck can also win through alternate win conditions like Grapeshot and Jace, Wielder of Mysteries. The use of Urza's Saga helps to find key artifacts like Grinding Station, while also providing additional mana resources.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board while ramping up quickly to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures. Utilizing cards like Kozilek's Command, Malevolent Rumble, and Ugin's Labyrinth for board control, along with Eldrazi Temple and Utopia Sprawl for ramping mana, it aims to play big threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. Karn, the Great Creator also gives versatility by fetching artifacts from the sideboard. With a mix of control elements and Eldrazi creatures, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with powerful plays.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures while controlling the board with various spells and abilities. It utilizes cards like Utopia Sprawl and Talismans to accelerate mana production, while also running removal spells like Kozilek's Command and Kozilek's Return to deal with threats. The deck also includes Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker for powerful late-game plays. Additionally, Karn, the Great Creator is included to provide utility and toolbox options. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with big threats while maintaining control of the game.

This deck focuses on utilizing Eldrazi creatures and powerful ramp spells to control the game and overwhelm the opponent with massive threats. By using cards such as Devourer of Destiny and Emrakul, the Promised End, the deck aims to quickly ramp into its big creatures and disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Sowing Mycospawn and Malevolent Rumble. The inclusion of cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Kozilek's Return provide additional control options and versatility. The deck's key strategy is to efficiently ramp into Eldrazi threats while controlling the board to dominate the game.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. The deck aims to stall the game with cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Consign to Memory, while generating card advantage with Nulldrifter and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. Additionally, cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and March of Otherworldly Light provide win conditions that can close out the game. The mana base is optimized for consistency and allows for the player to cast spells from multiple colors efficiently.

This deck focuses on disrupting opponents' strategies while establishing a strong board presence with aggressive creatures. By using cards like Solitude and Relic of Progenitus to control the board and disrupt graveyard strategies, combined with creatures like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Emperor of Bones to apply pressure, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents. Ephemerate and Flickerwisp provide additional value by blinking important creatures for extra triggers. Thoughtseize and Fatal Push help to control the opponent's hand and board, while White Orchid Phantom helps to ramp into more powerful plays. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and maximize consistency.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board and disrupting their strategy through counterspells, removal spells, and powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. The deck aims to ramp up to play these high-cost threats quickly using cards like Through the Breach and Talisman of Creativity. Karn, the Great Creator is included for additional utility and artifact disruption. The deck also includes a small burn package with cards like Kozilek's Command and Fire / Ice to help deal with threats. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent with its powerful threats and control elements.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating value with cards like Narset, Teferi, and Tune the Narrative. The deck utilizes a mix of efficient answers like Prismatic Ending and board wipes like Wrath of the Skies to maintain control of the game. The mana base is designed to provide consistency and flexibility in casting spells while also incorporating lands with additional utility. Overall, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and win through incremental advantage and resource management.

This deck focuses on using control spells and card advantage to dominate the game. With powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Narset, Parter of Veils, along with efficient removal like Prismatic Ending and Solitude, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating value. The deck also includes some unique cards like Tune the Narrative and Lórien Revealed for additional control options. Overall, the key strategy is to control the board, draw cards, and outlast the opponent until victory is secured.

This deck focuses on aggressive creature strategies with a mix of powerful creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing a mix of multi-color lands and spells, the deck aims to quickly establish a strong board presence and deal damage efficiently. Key cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Scion of Draco provide strong threats, while Leyline of the Guildpact and Tribal Flames help control the board and finish off opponents. The inclusion of Leyline Binding and Consign to Memory provide additional versatility and disruption against opposing strategies.

This deck focuses on playing aggressively using creatures with varying abilities and spells to control the board. By utilizing a mix of creatures with different strengths and weaknesses, along with removal spells and counter magic, this deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent before they can establish their own game plan. The mana base is designed to support a diverse range of colored spells and provide flexibility in casting spells when needed. Overall, this deck prioritizes speed and versatility in order to secure victory in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying artifacts onto the battlefield and using them to generate resources and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provide card advantage and help to recur key artifacts from the graveyard. Mox Opal and Urza's Saga help to accelerate the deck's mana production, allowing for explosive plays. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Portable Hole and Tormod's Crypt to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Ultimately, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and resilient board presence.

The main concept of this Modern Allosaurus Combo deck is to quickly find and play Griselbrand using summoning spells like Neoform and Eldritch Evolution. Allosaurus Rider is used to cheat out powerful creatures like Autochthon Wurm and Chancellor of the Tangle for explosive plays. The deck also utilizes Nourishing Shoal for life gain and protection, as well as Pact spells for additional combo pieces and protection. The overall goal is to assemble the combo pieces to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful board presence and win the game quickly.

This deck focuses on utilizing land-based ramp to quickly get out powerful creatures like Primeval Titan and Elesh Norn, Mother of Machines. The key strategy revolves around using Amulet of Vigor to untap lands for additional mana, allowing for explosive plays with Scapeshift and Urza's Saga. The deck also includes toolbox cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Boseiju, Who Endures to search for specific answers or threats. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly and overwhelm opponents with massive creatures and land synergies.

The main concept of this Amulet Titan deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor, with the ultimate goal of casting Primeval Titan to search for Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and other powerful lands to deal massive damage to the opponent. Cards like Scapeshift and Dryad of the Ilysian Grove help to enable the combo, while protective measures like Boseiju, Who Endures and Malevolent Rumble help to ensure the combo goes off successfully. The deck also includes utility lands like Tolaria West and Bojuka Bog for additional flexibility.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to cast big threats like Primeval Titan and combo pieces like Scapeshift. By utilizing cards like Amulet of Vigor and Arboreal Grazer, the deck aims to quickly get ahead on board and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats and land recursion. The inclusion of Urza's Saga and Green Sun's Zenith provides additional versatility and consistency to the deck's strategy. The deck's goal is to assemble its combo pieces efficiently and leverage its mana advantage to secure victory in the mid to late game.

The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a mix of powerful creatures and efficient removal spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes a combination of low-cost creatures like Ragavan and Guide of Souls, supported by efficient removal spells like Galvanic Discharge and Prismatic Ending. The deck also includes strong support cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ranger-Captain of Eos to further enhance the aggro strategy. Overall, the Boros Aggro deck aims to put early pressure on the opponent and finish the game swiftly with its aggressive creatures and spells.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a mix of aggressive creatures and burn spells. It aims to apply consistent pressure early in the game, playing cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls to attack swiftly. With cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker, it can also control the battlefield and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of Goblin Bombardment allows for extra reach and flexibility in finishing off the opponent.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a combination of low-cost creatures and efficient removal spells. The deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early on with creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Ocelot Pride, while also utilizing powerful Anthem effects from Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Guide of Souls to strengthen the board presence. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Goblin Bombardment and Static Prison to control the opponent's board, while cards like Seasoned Pyromancer and Ranger-Captain of Eos provide card advantage and flexibility in various situations.

The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly play aggressive creatures like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, supported by removal spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment. The deck also includes cards like Seasoned Pyromancer and Ocelot Pride for additional value and board presence. Static Prison and Blood Moon are used to disrupt opponents' strategies, while Arena of Glory provides additional combat benefits. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, with fetch lands like Arid Mesa and interaction lands like Elegant Parlor.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the combo potential of Underworld Breach along with Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to continuously loop through your graveyard, generating value and potentially winning the game with Thassa's Oracle. The deck also includes various artifacts and spells that synergize with the combo pieces, along with disruption and protection in the form of removal spells and counter magic. The land base supports the combo strategy and includes utility lands to provide additional advantages.

The deck focuses on quickly utilizing Grinding Station, Underworld Breach, and various cheap artifacts to loop through the graveyard and deck to win the game through a combo involving Thassa's Oracle and Emry, Lurker of the Loch. It uses disruptive spells like Swan Song and Lightning Bolt to protect the combo and control the game. The deck also includes cards like Mox Amber and Mishra's Bauble for mana acceleration and card draw, along with Urza's Saga to search for key pieces of the combo.

The deck focuses on using Underworld Breach to repeatedly cast spells from the graveyard, combining artifacts like Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal with Grinding Station to generate infinite mill and mana loops. Emry, Lurker of the Loch is key in recurring artifacts, while Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student helps dig for combo pieces. Thassa's Oracle serves as a win condition when the deck runs out of cards. The deck also includes disruption in the form of removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat, as well as counterspells like Spell Snare and Swan Song.

The deck focuses on using Underworld Breach to repeatedly cast spells from the graveyard, comboing off with Grinding Station and Malevolent Rumble to generate infinite mill and damage to the opponent. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Mishra's Bauble provide card advantage and enable the combo, while Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student helps dig for combo pieces. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Pithing Needle and Swan Song to protect the combo. Through careful sequencing and resource management, the pilot aims to assemble the combo and win the game in a single explosive turn.

The deck focuses on utilizing cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to set up a combo involving Underworld Breach and Grinding Station to quickly mill through the deck and win the game with either Grapeshot or Jace, Wielder of Mysteries. The deck includes various artifacts to generate mana and enable the combo, along with control elements like Lightning Bolt and Malevolent Rumble to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The land base is designed to support the color requirements of the cards in the deck while also utilizing Urza's Saga for additional value.

This deck aims to utilize the Underworld Breach combo to repeatedly cast powerful spells from the graveyard, eventually leading to a game-winning combo or overwhelming advantage. The deck includes various ways to generate mana, dig through the deck for key cards, disrupt opponents' strategies, and protect the combo pieces. By efficiently cycling through the deck and utilizing key cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Grinding Station, the deck can quickly assemble the necessary components for a lethal combo finish.

The main concept of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by using a combination of disruptive spells like Thoughtseize, Spell Snare, and Counterspell. It aims to control the board through removal spells such as Fatal Push and Dismember, while also utilizing creatures like Murktide Regent and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares to apply pressure. The deck also includes card draw and selection with Preordain and Consider, as well as additional counter magic with Force of Negation. The mana base is built to support the control elements with a variety of fetch lands and dual lands.

The deck focuses on using ramp spells and mana acceleration to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures ahead of schedule, overwhelming the opponent with their large threats. Control elements like removal spells and disruption are also included to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect your own creatures. The key strategy is to ramp up quickly and play big Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker to dominate the game and control the board. The deck aims to win through attrition and overwhelming the opponent with its powerful threats.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to play powerful Eldrazi creatures while controlling the board with spells like Kozilek's Command and Kozilek's Return. It also utilizes Sowing Mycospawn and Malevolent Rumble to create tokens and deal damage to opponents. With cards like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple, the deck can consistently play its high-cost threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. Karn, the Great Creator provides utility and removal options. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with big creatures and disruptive spells while maintaining board control.

This deck focuses on using ramp spells and mana acceleration to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker as quickly as possible. It also uses control elements like Kozilek's Return and Karn, the Great Creator to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain board control. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its big creatures while using removal and disruption to control the game until it can secure a victory. The combination of ramp, control, and powerful threats makes this deck a formidable force in Modern 1 vs 1 matches.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Emrakul and Griselbrand, then using cards like Goryo's Vengeance to bring them back into play for a game-ending combo. The deck also includes ways to protect these creatures and disrupt the opponent's strategy, such as Force of Negation and Thoughtseize. The strategy revolves around using instant reanimation effects and powerful synergy between the creatures and supporting spells to overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory.

The deck revolves around cycling creatures and controlling the board until you are able to cast Living End to bring all your creatures back from the graveyard onto the battlefield. Using cards like Subtlety and Force of Negation to disrupt your opponent's game plan, you can set up a powerful combo that can overwhelm your opponent with a swarm of creatures. By carefully managing your resources and timing your Living End, you can create a strong board presence and quickly finish off your opponent.

This deck focuses on aggressive play with a mix of creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It aims to put pressure on the opponent early with low-cost creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Orcish Bowmasters, while also utilizing burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to finish off opponents or clear threats. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Relic of Progenitus and Static Prison to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Additionally, Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provides additional support and power to the deck's creatures.

This Merfolk deck focuses on quickly building up a board presence with low-cost creatures like Mindspring Merfolk and Tide Shaper, while also utilizing abilities from Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident to boost the power of all Merfolk creatures. The deck includes disruption spells like Force of Negation and Flare of Denial to protect its creatures and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of Aether Vial allows for creatures to be played at instant speed, providing flexibility in combat and surprise plays. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its aggressive Merfolk creatures while maintaining control of the battlefield.

The main concept of this deck is to combine aggressive creatures with disruptive elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure. The deck utilizes a combination of powerful creatures like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Ketramose, the New Dawn along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Prismatic Ending to control the board. Additionally, cards like Relic of Progenitus and Thoughtseize are included to disrupt the opponent's graveyard and hand, respectively. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a mix of aggression and disruption.

The main focus of this deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures while disrupting their game plan with targeted removal and hand disruption. The deck aims to control the board through creatures like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Overlord of the Balemurk, while utilizing spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to keep the opponent on the back foot. Additionally, the deck has some flicker effects with Flickerwisp and Ephemerate to gain extra value from its creatures. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy while providing some utility lands for additional options.

This deck focuses on generating mana quickly and efficiently through spells like Desperate Ritual and Ruby Medallion, allowing for explosive plays utilizing Ral, Monsoon Mage and Questing Druid. The deck also includes cantrips and card draw to help find combo pieces like Past in Flames and Grapeshot. The inclusion of Wish allows for versatile toolbox options depending on the situation. The deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly to overwhelm the opponent and win in a single explosive turn.

The deck focuses on quickly generating mana with Ritual spells and Ral, Monsoon Mage's ability to cast multiple spells in a turn for free. It then uses Wrenn's Resolve and Wish to search for combo pieces like Grapeshot or Past in Flames to finish off the opponent. The deck also includes draw spells like Reckless Impulse and Glimpse the Impossible to dig for key cards. The goal is to chain together spells to create a storm count and deal lethal damage in a single turn.

The main concept of this UR Control deck is to control the game with a mix of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage from cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while gradually building up its own resources with key threats like Murktide Regent. The deck also includes some versatile spells like Subtlety and Force of Negation to deal with a variety of threats. Overall, the deck focuses on controlling the board and outvaluing the opponent in the long game.

This UW Control deck focuses on controlling the game through removal spells, counterspells, and powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Teferi, Time Raveler. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while slowly building up card advantage and mana efficiency. With a mix of efficient removal, counterspells, and card draw, this deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents in the long game. The inclusion of cards like Orim's Chant and Subtlety further adds to the controlling nature of the deck, allowing for more options to disrupt the opponent's strategies.
